summary: "The Crucible" is a play by Arthur Miller about the Salem witch trials in the late 1600s. It's also a metaphor for a political period in America called McCarthyism, where people were accused of being communists. Miller faced legal trouble for refusing to name people at meetings. The play was first performed in 1953 and won a Tony Award, but it took time to become popular. Now, it's considered a very important American play.
title: The Crucible
